variant.question: An operator that has a workforce of 25 full time equivalent staff is considered:

options.text: complex
small - complex
small
other than complex

variant.question: There are 2 Senior Cabin Crew on a flight

options.text: The Operator will nominate one to be Senior
The State of design will elect the Senior
The one with the most experience will be Senior
The Commander will nominate one to be Senior

variant.question: The maximum number of inexperienced flight crew members on board an aircraft is

options.text: no more than 65% of the flight deck
No crew should be inexperienced

variant.question: According to OPS regulations, an operator shall ensure that each cabin crew member is at least

options.text: 18 years old.
20 years old.
17 years old.
21 years old.

variant.question: When the presence of a cabin crew member(s) on a passenger carrying flight is required by regulations, the minimum number of cabin crew members on board generally is:

options.text: 1 cabin crew member for every 50, or fraction of 50, passenger seats installed on the same deck of the aeroplane
1 cabin crew member for every 25, or fraction of 25, passenger seats installed on the same deck of the aeroplane
1 cabin crew member for every 90, or fraction of 90, passenger seats installed on the same deck of the aeroplane
1 cabin crew member for every 75, or fraction of 75, passenger seats installed on the same deck of the aeroplane

variant.question: An operator shall ensure that all cabin crew members comply with the requirements of EASA AIR OPS regulations and any other safety requirements applicable to cabin crew. Define the "Cabin Crew":

options.text: Any appropriately qualified crew member, other than a flight crew or technical crew member, who is assigned by an operator to perform duties related to the safety of passengers and flight during operations
Any person assigned by the operator to perform specific duties in the cabin of an aircraft during the flight – for example a security staff.
Any crew member assigned by the operator, who performs duties in the cabin of the aircraft during the flight, in the interests of safety of passengers.
Any crew member, who performs, in the interests of safety of passengers, duties assigned to him/her by the operator in the cabin of an aeroplane.

variant.question: During the passenger service, moderate turbulence is experienced. What shall the Senior Cabin Crew member's first action be?

options.text: Immediately secure the cabin.
After the service, stow the trolley and secure the cabin.
Ensure that emergency exits are unobstructed.
Sit down and fasten seat belts.

variant.question: According to EASA AIR OPS, an operator shall ensure that each cabin crew member is at least:

options.text: 18 years of age.
21 years of age.
20 years of age.
17 years of age.

variant.question: An operator shall not appoint a person to the post of senior cabin crew member unless that person has at least ___ experience as an operating cabin crew member and has completed an appropriate course.

options.text: 12 months
24 months
9 months
6 months

variant.question: What is the minimum age of a crew member?
During turbulence in flight, in the absence of instructions from the commander, the senior cabin crew member..

options.text: is entitled to suspend non-safety-related activities and advise the flight crew to illuminate the “fasten seat belt” sign.
is entitled to suspend non-safety-related activities and ask one of the cabin crew members to illuminate the “fasten seat belt” sign.
can only suspend non-safety-related activities after getting permission from the commander.
is entitled to carry on with non-safety-related activities as long as he/she illuminates the “fasten seat belt” sign.

variant.question: During turbulence in flight, in the absence of instructions from the commander, the senior cabin crew member..

options.text: is entitled to suspend non-safety-related activities and advise the flight crew to illuminate the 'fasten seat belt' sign.
is entitled to carry on with non-safety-related activities as long as he/she illuminates the 'fasten seat belt' sign.
can only suspend non-safety-related activities after getting permission from the commander.
is entitled to suspend non-safety-related activities and ask one of the cabin crew members to illuminate the 'fasten seat belt' sign.

variant.question: During turbulence in flight, in the absence of instructions from the commander, the senior cabin crew member...

options.text: is entitled to suspend non-safety-related activities and advise the flight crew to illuminate the fasten seat belt sign.
is entitled to carry on with non-safety-related activities as long as he/she illuminates the fasten seat belt sign.
can only suspend non-safety-related activities after getting permission from the commander.
is entitled to suspend non-safety-related activities and ask one of the cabin crew members to illuminate the fasten seat belt sign.

variant.question:
According to the European Regulations on Air Operations, what are the minimum requirements for nomination as a Senior Cabin Crew Member? 
1. have at least 6 months of experience as operating cabin crew member.
2. have successfully completed a proficiency check.
3. have at least one year of experience as operating cabin crew member.
4. have successfully completed a senior cabin crew training course and the associated check.

options.text: 3 and 4
2 and 3
2, 3 and 4
1 and 4

variant.question: State the requirements regarding a senior cabin crew member; (This is a stupid question that comes down to terminology. The reference can be found in Air Ops, ORO.CC.200.b)

options.text: Must have one years experience and completed a senior cabin crew member training course as established by the operator
Must have two years experience and completed a senior cabin crew member training course as established by the operator.
Must have 24 months experience and completed a senior cabin crew member training course as established by the operator
Must have 18 months experience and completed a senior cabin crew member training course as established by the operator.

variant.question: According to the european regulations on air operations, which statement is correct when more than one cabin crew member is assigned for a flight?

options.text: The operator shall nominate a cabin crew member to be responsible to the pilot-in-command/commander.
The pilot-in-command shall nominate a cabin crew member to be responsible to the pilot-in-command/commander.
The competent authority shall assign a cabin crew member to be responsible to the pilot-in-command/commander.
The most experienced cabin crew member shall be responsible to the pilot-in-command/commander.

variant.question: You notice that a cabin crew is drunk. There’s 2 extra cabin crew than the minimum required for the flight. What shall you do?

options.text: Remove the cabin crew from the flight and inform the operator.
Cancel the flight.
Call the police and ask for advice.
Inform the ground handling agent so that he can call the police and arrest the intoxicated colleague.

variant.question: During the cruise flight in turbulence, the flight crew forgets to turn on the "Fasten Seat Belt" signs. What is the senior cabin crew member expected to do?

options.text: The senior cabin crew member discontinues all non-safety related duties and informs the flight crew.
The senior cabin crew member turns the "Fasten Seat Belt" signs on.
The senior cabin crew member continues to do non-safety related tasks since it is not the cabin crews responsibility.
The senior cabin crew member instructs another cabin crew member to turn the "Fasten Seat Belt" signs on.

variant.question: What requirements should a cabin crew member fulfil to become a senior cabin crew member?

options.text: 1 year experience as a cabin crew member and complete a specific senior cabin crew training course and successfully pass the associated check.
12 months experience as a cabin crew member and successfully pass a company skill test.
2 years experience as a cabin crew member and complete a specific senior cabin crew training course and successfully pass the associated check.
6 months experience as a cabin crew member and  successfully pass a company skill test.

variant.question: What is the minimum age of a cabin crew member?
Who has the final authority to carry out decisions concerning the specific composition of the cabin crew on a flight (including the authority to dismiss a cabin crew member from their duty)?

options.text: Commander.
Senior cabin crew member.
Operator.
Dispatcher.

variant.question: Who is responsible for ensuring cabin crew members are competent to perform their duties?

options.text: The operator.
The pilot-in-command.
EASA.
The senior cabin crew member.

variant.question: During boarding, the senior cabin crew member (SCCM) tells the commander that a (male) passenger who just boarded is quite drunk, but passive and friendly. The SCCM has told the passenger he will NOT be served any alcohol on the flight, which he has accepted without argument. The SCCM is happy for the passengers to travel. Which of the following is the most appropriate commander’s action?

options.text: If the commander thinks the passenger is NOT likely to endanger the aircraft or anybody on board, he can travel.
Because the passenger is intoxicated, he must be refused travel. The commander must tell the SCCM to off-load the passenger.
The passenger has committed an offence by trying to board the aircraft under the influence of drugs or alcohol. The commander should call the police to remove him.
Advise the the SCCM that refusing alcohol is discrimination against the passenger. He should be served alcohol along with the other passengers, or be off-loaded before departure.

variant.question: Consider a new aeroplane with 160 passenger seats. How many cabin crew members must operate this aircraft?

options.text: Four
One
Three
Five

variant.question: For a flight operated by 2 cabin crew members...

options.text: The Operator will nominate one to be Senior
The one with the most experience will be Senior
The Commander will nominate one to be Senior
The State of design will elect the Senior

variant.question: Turbulence is encountered during a flight, but the fasten seat belt sign remains off. What actions should the senior cabin crew member take?

options.text: The senior cabin crew member can suspend non-safety related duties in the cabin and ask the flight crew for the fasten seat belt sign to be switched on.
Carry on with non-safety related actions.
Suspend non-safety related actions and wait for the pilot until he/she turns them on.
The senior cabin crew member should instruct the passengers to fasten their seatbelts regardless of the fasten seat belt sign.
